definition: better to be safe than sorry (proverb)/to be prepared just in case
pinyin: bu4 pa4 yi1 wan4 , jiu4 pa4 wan4 yi1

definition: to be afraid/to fear/to dread/to be unable to endure/perhaps
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
